title: Boston lags behind other major cities in return to office, new study finds
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business While office attendance has reached new post-pandemic highs nationwide, Boston’s recovery remains slow.
A view of the Boston skyline.
David L Ryan/Globe Staff While people are returning to the office nationwide at record levels, Boston is slow to follow, according to a new report.

title: Several big T closures on tap for November
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Transportation The closures will be on the Orange, Green, Red, and Framingham/Worcester lines.
Crews working on the Orange Line in 2019.
Erin Clark /The Boston Globe, File ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Bill Belichick is among a dozen candidates for the Pro Football Hall of Fame’s 2026 class
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Will Bill Belichick make it to Canton next August?
The former Patriots coach just moved one step closer in the selection process.

FILE - New England Patriots head coach Bill Belichick holds up the Vince Lombardi Trophy as he celebrates after the Patriots defeated the Seattle Seahawks 28-24 in NFL Super Bowl XLIX football game Sunday, Feb.

title: Boston officials say new police initiative curbing shoplifting, but more work needed
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business At a City Council hearing, business leaders and police said shoplifting remains a problem in key retail areas.
Stores on Newbury Street removed products from their window displays.
Pat Greenhouse / The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Methuen police want you to name this puppy
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The police department is taking name suggestions through Thursday.
The community resource dog the Methuen Police Department is looking to name.
Methuen Police Department ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: New MetroWest grocery store closing after less than a year
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business The closure will leave the big box store empty again, after its former tenant, Bed Bath & Beyond, closed in 2020.
A storefront of The Fresh Market.
Associated Press ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Everett arson suspect arrested in Alabama
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Crime Lawrence Stockton allegedly started a fire at an Everett apartment building that displaced residents and caused extensive damage.
Earlier this month, a fire at an apartment complex in Everett displaced dozens of residents and caused hundreds of thousands of dollars in damage.
Authorities quickly determined that the fire was suspicious and began investigating.

title: A New England city just ranked among 10 trending travel destinations worldwide in 2026
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel A hint: It's acclaimed for its pizza.
New Haven skyline.

Adobe Stock By Kristi Palma October 21, 2025 | 12:03 PM 1 minute to read New Englanders can experience one of the planet’s trendiest travel destinations next year without traveling very far, according to Skyscanner.

title: Police make arrest after former Fall River mayor stabbed, seriously injured
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Will Flanagan was rushed to a local hospital Monday with significant injuries, Fall River police said.
Former Fall River Mayor William Flanagan in 2010.

Debee Tlumacki for the Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin October 21, 2025 | 11:55 AM 1 minute to read Fall River police have arrested a person of interest accused of seriously injuring the city’s former mayor, Will Flanagan, in a Monday evening stabbing.

title: ‘That’s the way he plays the game’: Ty Law defended Drake Maye after injury scare
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "That's why we love Drake Maye.
" Drake Maye following the Patriots' win over the Titans.

AP Photo/John Amis By Hayden Bird October 21, 2025 | 10:51 AM 2 minutes to read Ty Law’s take on Drake Maye: As the Patriots have rolled to a four-game winning streak in recent weeks, praise of quarterback Drake Maye has grown with each successive victory.
